item.title: Covid-19: Oxford University vaccine is highly effective
item.description: The vaccine is cheaper than other options and easier to distribute around the world.

item.title: Shanghai airport Covid scare sparks 'chaotic' mass testing
item.description: While state media show orderly queues at Pudong airport, social media videos suggest confusion.

item.title: Covid in North Dakota: One day inside a rural US hospital’s fight
item.description: Staff at a 14-bed hospital in North Dakota tell first-hand their fight to keep friends' family members alive.

item.title: Israel PM 'flew to Saudi Arabia for secret talks with crown prince'
item.description: It would mark the first known meeting between the leaders of the two historical foes.

item.title: Sidney Powell: Trump team cuts ties with lawyer who peddled bizarre fraud claims
item.description: Sidney Powell peddled conspiracy theories and promised to "blow up" Georgia with a "biblical" lawsuit.

item.title: Justice and the runaway jihadi bride
item.description: Why this case - which returns to court today - is bigger than the fate of one teenage runaway.

item.title: US election 2020: Trump ally Chris Christie urges him to accept defeat
item.description: Former Republican governor Chris Christie calls the president's legal team an "embarrassment".

item.title: Afghanistan war: 26,000 Afghan children killed or maimed since 2005
item.description: An average of five children have been killed or wounded every day, Save the Children says.

item.title: Trial of ex-president Sarkozy a landmark for France
item.description: Nicolas Sarkozy has gone on trial accused of corruption linked to his 2007 campaign funding.

item.title: It’s ‘sweet relief’ to be home, says US boy forced to threaten Trump in IS video
item.description: An American boy made to appear in an IS propaganda video in Syria is back in the US and doing well.

item.title: Ethiopia's Tigray crisis: UN urges protection of civilians
item.description: People in the region's capital are told to "save themselves" as the army advances on the city.

item.title: Cheers and tears as families reunite in Sydney
item.description: Flights between New South Wales and Victoria reopened for the first time since July.

item.title: Saudi surgeon dies at work in hospital operating room
item.description: The Saudi man was in theatre when colleagues began to fear he was suffering heart problems.

item.title: Why was The Weeknd covered in bandages at the AMAs?
item.description: The star won three awards, but his head was covered in bandages, leaving many fans confused.

item.title: The moment a dog was rescued from an alligator's jaws
item.description: Gunner was saved by his owner, and thankfully only suffered a small wound.

item.title: John Boyega stars in Steve McQueen's latest Small Axe film: Red, White and Blue
item.description: Life imitates art for John Boyega as he plays a police officer fighting racism, in the same year he took centre stage at the Black Lives Matters protest.

item.title: World's deepest diving pool opens in Poland
item.description: Deepspot is a diving pool that goes 45.5m (150ft) down and provides a space for divers to train.

item.title: Lea Volpe: 'Why are you calling me inspirational?'
item.description: Paraclimbing medalist Leanora Volpe doesn't like to be defined solely as a disabled athlete.

item.title: Elephant rescued from deep well in a 14-hour operation
item.description: It took a team of 50 people to carefully hoist the animal out, upside down.

item.title: The black jockey entering a white-dominated sport
item.description: Kanane Francis says he wants to encourage young black riders to get into horse racing.

item.title: Taiwan protesters march against US pork imports
item.description: Tens of thousands of people took to the streets of Taipei in Taiwan.

item.title: Cambridge paralysed dancer's hopes for wedding day 'slow dance'
item.description: Alex Collins became partially paralysed after diving into a shallow river to retrieve a plastic ring.

item.title: iPhone 12, Pixel 5 and Mate 40 Pro cameras put to the test
item.description: BBC Click puts four of the latest phones - including the iPhone 12 and Pixel 5 - to the test.

item.title: How a new type of glove can reduce environmental damage
item.description: Scientists at Cranfield University in Bedfordshire have developed a new type of latex.

item.title: Pompeii: Dig uncovers remains of rich man and slave killed by Vesuvius
item.description: The remains of two men are uncovered at a villa on the outskirts of the ancient Roman city.

item.title: Conjoined twins: 'We always knew we were different'
item.description: They made headlines when surgeons separated them - now Sanchia and Eman Mowatt are at university.

item.title: The assassination of a ‘Brave Journalist of Afghanistan’
item.description: Aliyas Dayee, a "voice for the voiceless" in Helmand, was killed by a bomb earlier this month.

item.title: Life after al-Shabab: Driving a school bus instead of an armed pickup truck
item.description: The Somali government retrains defectors from the al-Shabab militant group as barbers, drivers, mechanics and tailors.

item.title: Coronavirus vaccines: Will any countries get left out?
item.description: Experts say the pandemic needs a global solution, but there are concerns over access to vaccines.

item.title: Fur industry faces uncertain future due to Covid
item.description: Denmark's mass mink cull after a coronavirus outbreak at farms leaves the industry in the spotlight.

item.title: The deep roots of Trump’s 'voter fraud' strategy
item.description: The groundwork for the president's unsubstantiated claims was laid months ago.

item.title: The film crews being directed from a continent away
item.description: The pandemic has led to a big rise in remote filming, with directors miles away from the set.

item.title: US election 2020: Why Trump gained support among minorities
item.description: Joe Biden won the election, but support for Donald Trump increased among black and Latino voters. Why?

item.title: The Indonesian meteorite which didn't sell for $1.8m
item.description: You saw the headlines of a $1.8m meteorite? Here's the real story and it's just as fascinating.

item.title: China gives musical talent show a virtual makeover
item.description: Dimension Nova shakes up reality TV with computer-animated contestants performing to real judges.

item.title: India's most loved and loathed TV anchor
item.description: The star presenter is making Indian TV news louder and more aggressive than ever before.

item.title: Covid makes Brazil's president Bolsonaro a hero to some
item.description: President Jair Bolsonaro is seeing his approval ratings rise in the north-east of Brazil.

item.title: 'I am not sure if we will finish the season with 11 players' - Klopp urges broadcasters to fix schedule
item.description: Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp says they might struggle to end the season with 11 players and warns "we are all done" unless broadcasters talk to each other about the football schedule.

item.title: Sea Eagles prop Titmuss dies aged 20
item.description: Manly Warringah Sea Eagles player Keith Titmuss dies at the age of 20 after falling ill following a training session.

item.title: Why Guardiola's new contract could persuade Messi to join Man City
item.description: Guillem Balague explains why Pep Guardiola signing a new two-year Manchester City contract could help persuade Lionel Messi to join from Barcelona.

item.title: Arsenal and Leeds condemn 'vile' social media abuse of Pepe and Alioski
item.description: Arsenal and Leeds condemn the "vile" abuse directed at Nicolas Pepe and Ezgjan Alioski on social media after Sunday's draw at Elland Road.

item.title: Why ATP Finals champion Medvedev won't celebrate his victories
item.description: Daniil Medvedev claims the biggest win of his career at the ATP Finals but does not celebrate and says he never will.

item.title: Zlatan Ibrahimovic stars as Serie A leaders AC Milan beat Napoli
item.description: Zlatan Ibrahimovic scores twice before suffering an injury as unbeaten Serie A leaders AC Milan win away at Napoli.
